subject: RE: [junit] Integration between JUnit and bug tracker?

messageBody:
Forgive me, but isn't this rather contrary to the spirit of JUnit and its
TestInfected/XP approach? Kent says we're supposed to cycle through the
testing and coding stages a few times until our code has no bugs. So what
is there to track? same goes for integration: providing we're developing in
small enough chunks, of course.

Or look at it another way: our failed tests are their own bug
trackingdevice.

Automatically populating a bug track database from failed tests would only
make sense when the people running the tests aren't the same people who are
developing the code, for instance users in UAT or a "black box" testing
cell. I don't think JUnit is sufficiently abstract for the former but I can
see that the latter could be writing their own JUnit suites (if they know
Java). In which case your question is simply a variant on the "How do I log
output from JUnit?" question, only instead of writing to a logfile you want
to insert the results into an error tracking database. How difficult that
is depends on the database in question: if it's something proprietary like
Merant Tracker I imagine there'll be a few more problems than if (like us)
you're using a homebrew system based on tables sitting in your development
Oracle DB. The Bugzilla FAQ does say we write to the database using the
Mozilla XML API so it would be possible to do, but I think you'll be lucky
to find anyone who's actually done it :P

rgds, APC
